Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.701/S.988, the Social Worker Workforce Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote in the negative on this item:
Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola);

The following Council Member formally noted her intention to abstain from voting on this item:
Council Member Lee.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Social Worker Workforce Act (A.701/S.988).

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, September 25, 2025.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There is one vacant seat in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 4, 2025 General Election for the 2nd Council District in Manhattan.

There were 47 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Orders Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 20-A,  VOTE: 39-7-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. No. 1240-A,  VOTE: 39-7-0

Int. No. 1242-A,  VOTE: 39-7-0

Int. No. 1258-A,  VOTE: 40-6-0

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 9.10 and 9.60 of the Council Rules, the Speaker (Council Member Adams) coupled the three vetoed bills Int..Nos. 47-B, 1133-A, and 1135-A as Separate Questions.  

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Adams) asked that the three bills vetoed by the Mayor be considered for a vote before the remaining General Orders items.

The Speaker (Council Member Adams) put the question "Shall the bills pass, the objection of the Mayor notwithstanding?".  

The following three bills were decided in the affirmative by at least two-thirds of the Council vote required for passage:

Int. No. 47-B,  OVERRIDE VOTE: 35-9-3
Negative: Council Members Felder, Holden, Marmorato, Mealy, Morano, Narcisse, Paladino, Salamanca, and Vernikov;
Abstention: Council Members Moya, Ung, and Williams.

Int. No. 1133-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE:  40-7-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Mealy, Morano, Paladino, and Vernikov.

Int. No. 1135-A,  OVERRIDE VOTE:  39-8-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Mealy, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. Nos. 47-B, 1133-A, and 1135-A were adopted notwithstanding the objection of the Mayor and were thereby enacted into law pursuant to the City Charter.

Please see files for individual votes.
